info.name: E-commerce
info.description: A basic e-commerce application build using go/gin and utilizing microservice architecture.

item.name: Auth

request.description:
This HTTP POST request is used to register a new user. The request should include the user's email and password in the request body. Upon successful execution, the server responds with a status code of 201 and a JSON object containing the access and refresh tokens along with a message indicating the success of the account creation.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The email of the user to be registered.
- password (string, required): The password for the user's account.
    

### Response

- data (object): An object containing the access and refresh tokens.
    - access (string): The access token for the registered user.
    - refresh (string): The refresh token for the registered user.
- message (string): A message indicating the success of the account creation.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "access": "<access_token>",
        "refresh": "<refresh_token>"
    },
    "message": "Account created successfully!"
}

 ```

response.name: Register - Error Response

request.description:
### Login

This endpoint allows users to log in and obtain access and refresh tokens.

#### Request Body

- `email` (string, required): The email of the user.
- `password` (string, required): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

- `data` (object): An object containing access and refresh tokens.
    - `access` (string): The access token for authentication.
    - `refresh` (string): The refresh token for obtaining new access tokens.
- `message` (string): A message indicating the status of the login process.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "access": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...",
        "refresh": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
    },
    "message": "Logged in Successfully!"
}

 ```

response.name: Login - Error Response

item.description: Contains all auth related APIs like: Register, Login, Refresh Token etc.

item.name: User

request.description:
This HTTP PATCH request is used to update the profile details. The request should be sent to {{url}}/api/v1/profile/ with a raw request body. The request body should include the "email" and "name" fields to be updated.

### Request Body

- email (string, required): The new email for the profile.
- name (string, required): The new name for the profile.
    

### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- data (object): An object containing the updated profile details.
    - id (string): The unique identifier of the profile.
    - name (string): The updated name of the profile.
    - email (string): The updated email of the profile.
- message (string): A message indicating the success of the profile update.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "6379d63f-3c55-447e-8689-f3236ba1a535",
        "name": "asdsa",
        "email": "asdas@asd1.com"
    },
    "message": "Profile details updated successfully!"
}

 ```

response.name: Update user profile - Error Response

request.description:
This endpoint allows the user to change their password by sending an HTTP PUT request to the specified URL. The request should include the user's old password and the new password in the raw request body.

### Request Body

- old_password (string, required): The user's current password.
- new_password (string, required): The new password to be set.
    

### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- message (string): A message indicating the result of the password change operation.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "message": "Password changed successfully!"
}

 ```

# DELETE /api/v1/profile/

This endpoint is used to delete a user's profile.

### Response

- Status: 200
- Body:
    
    ``` json
      {
          "message": "Profile deleted successfully!"
      }
    
     ```

item.description: Contain all user related APIs like: GET, Update or Delete user profile

item.name: Internal APIs

request.description:
### Create User Token

This endpoint allows the internal users to create a token.

#### Request Body

- token (string, required): The token to be provided.
    

#### Response

- Status: 200 OK
- data (object)
    - id (string): The unique identifier of the user.
    - name (string): The name of the user.
    - email (string): The email address of the user.

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "d5ab452f-7f10-43a1-aea5-ff6642431f8b",
        "name": "asdsa",
        "email": "asdas@asd.com"
    }
}

 ```

## Product Details

This endpoint allows you to retrieve the details of a product by making an HTTP POST request to the specified URL.

### Request Body

- `id` (string, required): The unique identifier of the product.
    

### Response

- `data` (object): The object containing the product details.
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the product.
    - `created_at` (string): The timestamp when the product was created.
    - `modified_at` (string): The timestamp when the product was last modified.
    - `name` (string): The name of the product.
    - `price` (number): The price of the product.
    - `description` (string): The description of the product.

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "168ce127-4108-4333-82de-b08d381beb20",
        "created_at": "2024-01-01T07:35:22.975071Z",
        "modified_at": "2024-01-01T07:35:22.975071Z",
        "name": "saasdasd12",
        "price": 10,
        "description": "asdsdad"
    }
}

 ```

item.description: Contains all internal APIs which is used by the micro-services to pass data back & forth

item.name: Product

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a new product by sending an HTTP POST request to {{product_service_url}}/api/v1/product/. The request should include a JSON payload in the raw request body type with the fields "name", "price", and "description".

### Request Body

- `name` (string): The name of the product.
- `price` (number): The price of the product.
- `description` (string): A description of the product.
    

### Response

Upon a successful creation, the endpoint returns a status code 201 and a JSON response with the following structure:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "e548cf02-e708-4657-b83d-42b732a8ffab",
        "created_at": "2023-12-31T14:03:37.632623Z",
        "modified_at": "2023-12-31T14:03:37.632623Z",
        "name": "saasdasd1",
        "price": 10,
        "description": "asdsdad"
    },
    "message": "Product Created Successfully!"
}

 ```

The `data` object contains the details of the newly created product, including its unique identifier, creation timestamp, modification timestamp, name, price, and description. The `message` field provides a success message.

In case of an error, the response will include relevant error details.

# Get Product Details

This API endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the details of a specific product by providing its unique identifier in the URL.

## Request

- Method: GET
- URL: `{{product_service_url}}/api/v1/product/da087a43-3c1c-40d5-a6b3-13299eecc509/`
    

## Response

- Status: 201
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "da087a43-3c1c-40d5-a6b3-13299eecc509",
        "created_at": "2023-12-31T14:21:49.231915Z",
        "modified_at": "2023-12-31T14:21:49.231915Z",
        "name": "saasdasd4",
        "price": 10,
        "description": "asdsdad"
    }
}

 ```

This endpoint allows you to update the details of a specific product using an HTTP PATCH request. The request should be sent to {{product_service_url}}/api/v1/product/da087a43-3c1c-40d5-a6b3-13299eecc509/. The request body should contain a JSON payload with the fields you want to update, such as "name".

### Request Body

- name (string, required): The updated name of the product.
    

### Response

Upon a successful update, the endpoint will return a status code of 200 along with the updated details of the product in the response body.

#### Response Body

- data (object): An object containing the updated details of the product, including id, created_at, modified_at, name, price, and description.
- message (string): A message confirming the successful update of the product details.
    

#### Example Response

``` json
{
    "data": {
        "id": "da087a43-3c1c-40d5-a6b3-13299eecc509",
        "created_at": "2023-12-31T14:21:49.231915Z",
        "modified_at": "2023-12-31T14:42:19.218467Z",
        "name": "saasdasd567",
        "price": 10,
        "description": "asdsdad"
    },
    "message": "Product details updated Successfully!"
}

 ```

This HTTP DELETE request is used to delete a specific product by providing the product ID in the URL. The request does not contain a request body.

### Request

- Method: DELETE
- URL: {{product_service_url}}/api/v1/product/da087a43-3c1c-40d5-a6b3-13299eecc509/
    

### Response

- Status: 200
- Body:
    
    ``` json
    {
        "message": "Product deleted successfully!"
    }
    
     ```
    

This request returns a status code of 200 upon successful deletion of the product, along with a message indicating the success of the operation.

# Product List Retrieval

This endpoint retrieves a list of products with optional pagination by providing an offset parameter in the query.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET /api/v1/product/`

### Query Parameters

- `offset` (integer, optional): Specifies the number of items to skip before starting to return results.
    

## Response

- `results` (array): An array containing the details of the retrieved products.
    - `id` (string): The unique identifier of the product.
    - `name` (string): The name of the product.
    - `price` (number): The price of the product.
    - `description` (string): The description of the product.

### Example Response

``` json
{
    "results": [
        {
            "id": "5bcb47f4-8736-4e2a-be5d-06b2a1d36a93",
            "name": "saasdasd",
            "price": 10,
            "description": "asdsdad"
        },
        {
            "id": "b6a50353-9d32-498d-8840-cb3b4fbff4ae",
            "name": "saasdasd1",
            "price": 10,
            "description": "asdsdad"
        },
        ...
    ]
}

 ```

request.description:
This HTTP DELETE request is used to delete a specific order by providing the order ID in the URL. The request does not require a request body.

### Request

- Method: DELETE
- URL: `{{order_service_url}}/api/v1/order/22e5722d-6888-413a-b4bd-349c88a95ef8/`

### Response

- Status: 200
- Body:

```json
{
    "message": "Order deleted successfully!"
}
```

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to {{url}}/health-check/ to perform a health check. The request does not include a request body.

### Response

- Status: 200

``` json
{ "message": "up and running" }

 ```
